snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who threatened a new inquiry into the scandal involving Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, asked people to take a deep breath before criticizing the state panel already investigating it.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces that he is open to seeking changes in the Joint Commission on Public Ethics, one of the signature achievements of his tenure; move comes after Ravi Batra, who resigned from the commission, warned of 'possible illegality and corruption' in its operations, and other commissioners expressed concerns that the panel was losing its credibility.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who threatened a new inquiry into the scandal involving Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, asked people to take a deep breath before criticizing the state panel already investigating it.

headline.seo: Cuomo Says He’s Open to ‘Tweaks’ in Ethics Panel
